website_summaries.verdict: A popular rangefinder by a top-selling brand with excellent range and a compact design.
pros: Impressive range for a mid-level price
The lightweight, streamlined design makes it easy to tuck into your pocket and go
cons: Although rare, occasional inaccuracies are possible
Some owners found the text of the readings difficult to read

customer_reviews.title: Ranges animals great at extreme distances
customer_reviews.text: I tested it around the house and farm fields. consistently ranged trees at 1294 yards, 5 foot bushes and brush at 800 to 1100 yards. Homes and building, 1400 yards no problem. Now the real data, I ranged a Prong Horn Antelope at 632 yards and many other at all distance below that. I ranged a beef cow at 847 yards. This range finder is the real deal and the price is awesome, I've bought other way more expensive range finder's and they DID NOT perform even close to this Kilo1200. Totally happy with this range finder right now and I strongly recommend it. I will test it hard on Bears in August this year, 2019.
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: Finally down to a price point I could justify.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting one of these for quite a while now. It is finally at a price point that I can only slightly regret the purchase. Great Range Finder. Partnered up with an LRI holder and tripod works great for in the field or shooting competitions.
customer_reviews.author: J. Payne

customer_reviews.title: Best price
customer_reviews.text: First glance quality is excellent. Looks good, operates as described and is extremely portable. Didn't realize how compact they are. Had these on my wish list for awhile. The price dropped and I checked a dozen other sites and they were the cheapest by about $50 . I'v had other range finders in the past that didn't last a season so for right now they only get a high three stars. Like I stated initial quality is off the charts but the shine will fade and I will check back later with a follow up.
customer_reviews.author: J.D

customer_reviews.title: You need this
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks! Fits in your pocket, Super lightweight, simple as it gets and very accurate I’ve been able to range deer at 935yds, and a 18”x20” plate at 1274. Exact same ranges as my friends $2000 Leica!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Extremely difficult to read ranges
customer_reviews.text: Having this out to my local outdoor range it was off about 10% at 50 yards and at 250 yards. But not consistently sometimes showing 220ish and up to 279 at the longer distance. Value for money they aren’t bad. But if this is what stands between you and a once in a lifetime shot. I’d rather leave them at home and eyeball it. The other issue is that the range text is difficult to read. Overall this feels like a product that sig tacked their name onto. Because they typically deliver exceptional products
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: If you need a high quality range finder buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased with this purchase. Light weight, accurate, and fast and simple to use. I purchased this unit for long distance rifle target shooting. I use the info I get from this Kilo 1200 and input it into my ballistic phone app for accurate shots. My first unit arrived defective and was replaced immediately and even before I shipped back the bad one.
customer_reviews.author: lunasea

customer_reviews.title: Great value, but:
customer_reviews.text: I don’t use the case it comes with, because in the field, I don’t have time to take it out of the case then range then shoot. I put a longer lanyard on it, but since the holding brackets are so close to the eye piece, it dangles awkwardly, instead of flat against your body. Sight is clear and bright. Just my .2cents
customer_reviews.author: Peter R.

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level range finder
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a great entry into range finders. Easy to use, light and as far as I can tell, extremely accurate. The ability to measure angle distance as well as horizontal distance is crucial to a shooter so that an accurate hold point can be figured out to compensate for bullet drop. Hard to beat the features on this range finder in this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Kelly

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It does what is expected of it. Works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement for my old rangefinder
customer_reviews.text: Had a Leupold for about 6-8 years. The display simply started to deteriorate - the unit was just sitting in its case in my office and when I tried to use it, half or more of the screen was faded to where it was unreadable. Found this SIG on sale and am very pleased with it - does everything I need (range out to about 600-800 yds) for target and possibly deer hunting sometime in the future. Super easy to use - out of the box it was already setup to what I needed. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to read
customer_reviews.text: Looking through this monocular and shooting your laser is fine, however, it is difficult to see the readings inside the lens. The print is black and, as far as I know, I am unable to change the brightness of it. In other words, you should be able to change the illumination given the difference in your ambient light and visibility. I have not used this in the field, but I do not have high hopes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Weber

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings.
customer_reviews.text: First off the product is extremely light. It easy to use and seems accurate. The display is black, which can make it hard to read on darker objects. I really liked it, but after taking it in the field with me a few a times, a black speck has appeared on the inside of the lens. It doesn't obstruct the lens to the point that it is unusable, but it is rather annoying. I contacted the seller and they are going to send me a return label. Sonic will be without a range finder for a couple weeks during hunting season. Not exactly ideal.

customer_reviews.title: Point a click - Works Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I read several reviews for rangefinders and was about to take my chances on a cheap one. Then I found this for just a little more. Glad I made this purchase. It works great for me. All of my uses are for less 500 yards. I spot blackbirds on my lawn more than 100 yards away and it works great. Seems to pick up everything I point it at up to 1000 yards. Glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: ABD

customer_reviews.title: decent
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a cheap range finder this is it. But it does have some problems. I have a hard time seeing what the reading is. If you can't see it then it is worthless. I haven't given it a full test yet. Just played with it outside in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Donny

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use, super crisp, and accurate
customer_reviews.text: This rangefinder is amazing. The picture is extremely clear, better than any binoculars and monoculars I've used. The digital print in the viewfinder is crisp and easy to read. It's fun to use and very accurate. I recommend this for hunting and using at the shooting range.
customer_reviews.author: Rob P

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This range finder is awesome. Love it. For under $200 bucks it's sure amazing. It reads both yards and meters, incorporates angles at the same time. It's clear, durable and has a perfect fixed zoom. I'm impressed indeed. No complaints whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: The Medlins

customer_reviews.title: Great Range Finder
customer_reviews.text: So far it is a great range finder. I have not had a chance to use it in the field yet. The comment I wanted to make is for you to watch the price of this range finder. I paid $166.25. The price on this changes quite often so if you are not in a rush, watch the price and it will drop. It is definitely worth $166.25.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great range finder for the money
customer_reviews.text: Amazing range finder for under 200. Clear glass. Easy to use and read. Only had it out to 600 so far but hasn’t had any problems. Needed something that wouldn’t break the bank for archery deer and turkey hunting. Just can’t see spending over 500 on one of these. At that rate I’ll buy a new gun.
customer_reviews.author: clint parnell

customer_reviews.title: Blown away by this device!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is about the size of a deck of cards and probably lighter. It is so easy to use. Just paint the object you're trying to range with the red dot in the viewfinder. Quick, accurate measurements. It even compensates for the angle of measurement if you want it to, or you can turn that feature off and compensate for angles yourself. I haven't worked it out on the range yet and will update if the accuracy I've observed so far doesn't hold up.
customer_reviews.author: prosumer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and light weight
customer_reviews.text: Just used this on a hunt in TN and it worked great! The farthest I ranged out to was about 600 yds. I’m sure it would of ranged farther but there wasn’t a clear distance longer. It was super light weight and very accurate. One of the guys that went with had a much more expensive one and this one was right on.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great distance and accucacy for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Nikon in past and this Sig seams to have much better distance at about same price. Great Value.
customer_reviews.author: Kim J. Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I have ranged with it out to 900 yards and double checked it on Google earth. It is very accurate. If a smaller animal like a coyote is in high grass it is a little hard to get a good range on it.
customer_reviews.author: Model 70 Owner

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This has been good for me so far. I’ve not used it on extreme angles yet or past 700 yds. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Higginbottom

customer_reviews.title: solid unit
customer_reviews.text: Unit works good, fast acquisition of distances with one button, I would recommend product to anyone looking for an affordable accurate way to measure distances from close to far.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this range finder. I am impressed with how far it can pick out objects. For the money, I am completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: B. Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Well made, accurate, lightweight, startlingly clear beautiful 4 power image.
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to find the distance to my photographic subject when I want precise focus for landscape photography. It is very high quality and very accurate. It give a startlingly good clear 4 power image so it doubles as a monocular. Very compact and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: David Werrett

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. I use it for long range shooting and hunting. Only wish is that it had threads on the bottom to mount to a tripod.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Great buy. Not used I a bunch but when I have used it it was great. And warranty is touch notch
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Able to measure in tight spaces like between rows of trees without picking up surrounding objects.
customer_reviews.author: William Vance

customer_reviews.title: Will not range an animal to advertised distance.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rangefinder for big game hunting, and after receiving it I noticed the effective animal range was far below the reflective target range. This seems to be a common theme with rangefinders and seems the advertising is misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for my son. He’s really pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, small and simple to use, Quality build
customer_reviews.text: A need if you want to know exact distance. Small simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: WearAll Hats

customer_reviews.title: No problems
customer_reviews.text: Used it for one hunting season. So far no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jason King

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, accurate and easy to use. I was looking for my first laser rangefinder and after assessing some of the more expensive models with lots of extra bells and whistles found this one to fit all my needs and not break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Tregonwell

customer_reviews.title: so simple my 6 year old can use it
customer_reviews.text: These thing seems very accurate and has a quality feel to it
customer_reviews.author: Scotty D.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, light, great for general range use and shooting.
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in my truck and its been fantastic fro shooting and for general range finding. Used it at work on construction sites just as much as I've used it outdoors. Super accurate and easy to use. One click range finding.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Poor design.
customer_reviews.text: Reticle does not illuminate. Good luck trying to see it in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: ghost202

customer_reviews.title: Quality is critical when bow hunting in remote Colorado.
customer_reviews.text: I like the scan function. Worked well for first month but when I got to Colorado for my elk hunt one of the display bars in the yardage characters stopped working so you can’t tell if yards are 50 or 60 yards. Critical for bow hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy W. May

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product at reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Fast accurate lightweight and simple. I think this product will satisfy 99% of hunters/golfers/outdoorsman. I’ve used lots of rangefinders. This is a winner
customer_reviews.author: Ellen T. Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Very poor packing for an expensive electronic device.
customer_reviews.text: Product is ok so far but whoever did the packing needs to pack up and find another job.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W. Brown

customer_reviews.title: ♤♤♤Sig-Did-It!♤♤♤Just Buy-It!☆☆☆☆☆
customer_reviews.text: This Blew Away My Former Leopold by Lightyears! Superior Optics, Electronics, Fast Scans, Repeatability, Reliability,& Accuracy!
customer_reviews.author: D.S.

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product. Easy to use right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: OregonBookSeller

customer_reviews.title: Rangefinder
customer_reviews.text: These were a gift for my adult son. He loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very impressed so far
customer_reviews.text: very happy so far, was super surprised at how far the first reading was
customer_reviews.author: rrc

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Best for money clear and accurate even in thick wooden leaf trees
customer_reviews.author: nathan savon

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my husband. He said it’s just what he needed. Guess it worked because he shot a nice cow elk less than two hours after he left the house..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Sig Sauer 4x20 KILO1200 Laser Rangefinder (Black, Class 3R)
product_meta.description: The Sig Sauer Kilo 1200 is one of the most advanced, yet simple to use rangefinder on the market and features the fastest, digital signal processing engine while streamlining the user interface for a no hassle, out of the box experience. This hunting laser rangefinder features lightwave DSP with hyperscan ranges 4x/second for unprecedented speed and accuracy at extreme distances. Ranging Performance in hyperscan mode - Reflective up to 1,600 yards; Trees up to 700 yards; Deer up to 600 yards. Additional Information Lens Coating - SpectraCoat CR2 Battery Type Eye Relief - 24 mm Exit Pupil Diameter - 5 mm Angle Compensation Reflective Target - 1600 yards Non-Reflective Target - 600 yards Field of View at 100 Yards - 45.53' feet Includes battery, padded ballistic nylon case, lanyard Compact form factor easily fits in pocket Scan mode refreshes at ultra fast 4x/second Twist eyecup for individualized, custom fit Sleek design for one handed operation and lanyard at

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
